page.title: 10Recreation
page.content: iery.On the west an old wood,cut down in 1947 is being replanted. The Park is a very attractive centre for many activities such as Country Fairs,Treasure Trails,Nature Trails and Equestrian Events.Activities for children are usually held during school holidays and are very popular. In the Park there are many different gardens such as Butterfly,Bee,and Bird gardens.To encourage wild life in the area school children have planted special plants such as:Ox Eye Daisy, Holly,Hazel,Docks,Wild Carrot,Teasle,Field Poppy and Thyme. Future plans for the Park include opening a craft workshop and a cafe.
